ygData.subject: Re: what should i be looking for now?
ygData.msgSnippet: i can t believe u guys don t know about the blackened iron crown that u can get as a QUEST ITEM at lvl 12....go to butcher block mountains and kill the 2 named
ygData.messageBody:
i can't believe u guys don't know about the blackened iron crown that u can
get as a QUEST ITEM at lvl 12....go to butcher block mountains and kill the
2 named trolls...then take there heads to the sheriff in kaladim and DING u
got a crown



>From: Dan Leavy <dan@...>
>Reply-To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
>To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] what should i be looking for now?
>Date: Wed, 14 Jul 1999 12:09:05 -0400
>
>From: Dan Leavy <dan@...>
>
>
>
>David Rogers wrote:
>
> > From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
> >
> > --- Dan Leavy <dan@...> wrote:
> >
> > First, from some comments you made I can see you're
> > another player who doesn't understand the Everquest
> > armor system.
> >
> > AC IS NOT EVERYTHING! AC is the second half, and the
> > lesser half, of the armor system in Everquest. The
> > first half is damage absorption. The armor sequence
> > is:
> >
> > Naked > Cloth > Patchwork > Leather > Ringmail >
> > Chainmail > Banded > Plate
> >
> > Each level of armor absorbs more damage than the
> > levels before it. If you doubt, try it. Fight
> > something on your level naked and see how badly you
> > get hit; every shot will come in at max damage. Put
> > your armor back on and see shots hitting for 2, 5,
> > etc...
> >
> > Look at Rangers, who can't wear better than banded,
> > fighting along side a Warrior. Ranger in full banded,
> > dual wielding; gets hammered and has to be healed much
> > more often than the dual wielding Warrior in full
> > plate. Warrior takes less damage per shot. Put the
> > Warrior in banded and watch him start taking damage
> > like the Ranger, needing more heals. PLATE IS WORTH
> > IT.
> >
> > Plate is a requirement to be an effective tank past
> > 20ish. Now you have to make some concessions for good
> > buffs (I still wear *my* Spiked Collar for the +3
> > Strength; but it's just a collar), but you want to be
> > in mostly plate.
>
>ahhh thanks!! i didnt know this at all...i thought it was all based on
>AC...
>i shall def take your advice and switch to bronze arms again...also the one
>slot i forgot was the belt...ive currently got the blackened girdle with
>plus 5 stam...is it better to go for the bronze one then?
>
>and ill be on the lookout for erollisi bracer and bracer of battle
>
>
>
> >
> >
> > >>> collar of undead prot => Spiked Collar (+3 STR)
> > > - ive got a spiked collar but went in favour of the
> > > undead one...with better AC
> >
> > Personal taste. I value, right now, stat enhancement
> > over saves.
> >
> > >>> blackened helm => Bronze Helm or B.Iron Crown
> > > --- sorry i menat B iron crown, not blackened helm
> >
> > Stick with the Crown then; +5 STR is sweet and is
> > worth taking the Chainmail hit on the head for.
> >
> > >>> barbed arms => Bronze Arms --- my barbed arms
> > > are only 1 ac less than bronze, but give +2 dex
> >
> > See above comments about plate vs chain (which is what
> > barbed armor is equalivalent to). +2 Dex isn't worth
> > the plate armor value at 30th level. Get Dex rings if
> > you're looking for Dex.
> >
> > >>> lizardscale cloak => Bronze Cloak --- lizard is
> > > same Ac as bronze but lighter and plus 5 dex
> >
> > See above comments about plate. +5 Dex is much better
> > than +2 for Barbed Arms, but it's still kinda grey.
> > You might want to stick with this one, maybe. It
> > doesn't protect as well as plate though.
> >
> > My 25th Paladin is set up like this:
> >
> > PG Tomahawk
> > SB Shield
> > Bronze Helm
> > +2 AGI Onyx Earrings (2)
> > +7 DEX Grotesque Mask
> > +3 STR Spiked Collar
> > +3 STR, +10 Magic BS Mantle
> > Bronze Arms
> > +3 DEX, +1 STR Bracer of Battle
> > +5 STR Bracer of Erollsi
> > Bronze Gauntlets
> > +2 STR Rings (2)
> > Bronze Breastplate
> > Bronze Cloak
> > Bronze Girdle
> > Bronze Legs
> > Bronze Boots
> >
> > I'm currently looking for Dwarven Workboots and a
> > Blackened Iron Crown. Workboots are a rare drop, but
> > I'm patient (and willing to pay well); problem with
> > the BI Crown is I *hate* Runnyeye (very dangerous
> > dungeon, imo); and the KS Wizards who show up with a
> > BI Crown aren't interested in selling. Every BI Crown
> > I see is for trade only in exchange for caster items.
> > GRRRRRRRR.
> >
> > I'm going to trade my Onyx Earrings for Gold-Amber (+3
> > STR each), and my +2 STR Rings for Gold-Onyx (+5 DEX
> > each). If I could just find someone who works Gold
> > ....
> >
> > My current 'buff' set up is +16 STR, +4 AGI (which I'm
> > going to dump for more STR and DEX), and +10 DEX. I
> > also have a Savant's Cap, two +2 INT rings and a BI
> > Medallion; I can be +10 INT when I'm training skills,
> > which comes in hand when you're naturally 60 INT. If
> > I can get the Workboots, BI Crown and switch my rings
> > and earrings like I want, my buffs will look like
> > this: +26 STR, +25 DEX. That would put STR at 136 and
> > DEX at 115.
> > ===
> > :D
> > Dave's World
> > -No matter where you go, there you are-
> > "People will believe a lie either because they want to
> > believe it's true, or because they fear it is." Wizard's
> > First Rule, Sword of Truth, Terry Goodkind
